verses.roman:
karmāṇy aparimeyāṇi
manasāpi sureśvaraiḥ
saha-saṅkarṣaṇaś cakre
bhagavān madhusūdanaḥ

synonyms: karmāṇi—activities; aparimeyāṇi—immeasurable, unlimited; manasā api—even by such plans perceived within the mind; sura-īśvaraiḥ—by the controllers of the universe like Brahmā and Śiva; saha-saṅkarṣaṇaḥ—along with Saṅkarṣaṇa (Baladeva); cakre—performed; bhagavān—the Supreme Personality of Godhead; madhu-sūdanaḥ—the killer of the Madhu demon.
translation: The Supreme Personality of Godhead, Kṛṣṇa, with the cooperation of Saṅkarṣaṇa, Balarāma, performed activities beyond the mental comprehension of even such personalities as Lord Brahmā and Lord Śiva. [For instance, Kṛṣṇa arranged the Battle of Kurukṣetra to kill many demons for the relief of the entire world.]
